alert.note: Alert for Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 6:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern San Juan and southeastern Grand Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 644 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of La Sal, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern San Juan and southeastern Grand Counties. This includes Colorado 90 between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
